father, and the affection – the excessive
affection – that you had for me when
you first returned will I hope excuse
me in your eyes that I dare to speak
to you, although with ^the tender affection

a friend and equal. But pardon me,
I entreat you and listen to me: do not
turn away from me; do not be impa-
tient; you may easily intimidate me

nor can I willingly consent to endure

which for the last four months has
been my portion.
